title: Noel Dolton
text:
Noel Dolton (birth unknown), also known by the <a href="nickname">nickname</a> "Tombstone", is an Australian former professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1950s and 1960s. He played at representative level for <a href="Commonwealth%20XIII%20rugby%20league%20team">Commonwealth XIII</a>, and at club level for <a href="Newtown%20Jets">Newtown</a>, <a href="Parramatta%20Eels">Parramatta</a>, <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> (<a href="List%20of%20Wakefield%20Trinity%20players">Heritage № 701</a>) and the <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs Magpies</a> as a or , i.e. number 8 or 10, or, 11 or 12, during the era of contested <a href="Scrum%20%28rugby%29%23Rugby%20league">scrum</a>s.
International honours.
Playing career.
Noel Dolton represented <a href="Commonwealth%20XIII%20rugby%20league%20team">Commonwealth XIII</a> while at Wakefield Trinity in 1965 against New Zealand at <a href="Crystal%20Palace%20National%20Sports%20Centre">Crystal Palace National Recreation Centre</a>, <a href="London">London</a> on Wednesday 18 August 1965.
Club career.
Noel Dolton made his debut for <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity</a> during December 1964, and he played his last match for Wakefield Trinity during the <a href="1965%E2%80%9366%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1965–66 season</a>
